title: DO NOT MISTAKE FOR PATAL BHUVANESHWAR , OFF GANGOLIHAT
review: Patal Devi Mandir is in Almoda district and patal bhuvaneshwar is a cave temple in pithoraghar District off Gangolihat.

title: Excellent Temple
review: Divine temple at the devbhoomi. Temple is dedicated to patal devi and underground temple. The temple is very important worship place in the region and lot of people visit the place.

title: peaceful and cool after a long walk up
review: we enjoyed finding the temple after a long walk up the mountain. there was a peaceful ambiance and we enjoyed our short visit.

title: Divine
review: Uttarakhand.. Land of the gods. There are as many temples as there are men. However u'd never get tires of visiting them one after the other as all have their own charm.

title: Old temple
review: It is an old temple situated on highway. This place is believed to be very mighty among locals here.

title: Small but beautiful
review: This place infrastructure is not very big but temple is very much beautiful and peaceful. Good for practicing meditation.

title: The Age old Temple
review: We could see the temple from Mata Anondomoyee ashram. Learnt that it is a couple of centuries old. The place looked calm & serene.

title: ancient temple
review: Patal Devi Temple  is one of nine temples in Almora dedicated to nine forms of Durga.The temple is situated at village Shail. It is about 200 years old and is at a very beautiful location in village Shail.There are 4 natural water sources around the temple.It's an ancient temple.The temple is a nice walk downhill from the main road and most of the times completely deserted.

title: Old shiv temple
review: This is an old shiv temple in town. This is really peaceful and happening place. This place is good for family also.

title: Beautiful ancient mandira
review: pāṭala devī mandira, Shail Village, Almora. Not to be confused with Patal Bhuvaneshwar underground cave temple (this is not it). A beautiful old mandira, at least 200 years old, likely much older. Still in regular use. As the name implies, the is a devī mandira, with a tiger on the gopura, yet it is  nandi who oversees the mandira on the ground level.

title: Patal Devi Mandir
review: Dangerous climb down through a narrow hole in the ground. Very steep, wet steps. Not worth the trouble.

title: Patal Bhuvaneshwar Mandir
review: It is a unique cave temple and it is UNDERGROUND! One has to go through a very difficult passage consisting of a mix of small uneven steps and small rocks on which one has to slide about 2 ft at a few places. There are two chains on the sides and one has to hold the same and go down. The chains are also wet and the devotee has to go down in a sitting posture as there is NO STANDING ROOM. At one place one has to go between two rocks; NOT recommended for old, infirm and fat persons. It is such relief to reach floor of the cave! The sights inside the cave make one forget the trouble of reaching there. The Jata of Shiv in white, hanging from the roof of the cave is absolutely breath-taking; as also the thousand feet of Airawatha elephant.As the air circulation inside is insufficient for a large number of people, at a given time, only a few persons are taken inside.

title: Do not miss this
review: A place you would never know existed, a mandatory must visit
